thread.title: Body found in Marissa landfill identified as 23-year-old St. Louis woman
thread.title_full: Body found in Marissa landfill identified as 23-year-old St. Louis woman

author: From staff reports
title: Body found in Marissa landfill identified as 23-year-old St. Louis woman
text:
1 of 2 Photo courtesy of KTVI 
St. Louis police investigate after a body was discovered at a landfill in Marissa on Tuesday, Jan. 31, 2017. Photo courtesy KTVI 
Brandy Morrison was reported missing Saturday, Jan. 28, 2017. Body found in Marissa landfill identified as 23-year-old St. Louis woman From staff reports 
Brandy Morrison was reported missing Saturday, Jan. 28, 2017. Photo courtesy of KTVI 
St. Louis police investigate after a body was discovered at a landfill in Marissa on Tuesday, Jan. 31, 2017. Photo courtesy KTVI 
MARISSA • The body of a woman found in a landfill here has been identified as 23-year-old Brandy Morrison of the 5600 block of Hiller Place in St. Louis. 
Police say Morrison was fatally shot in the 6100 block of Laura Avenue in St. Louis sometime between Friday and Monday. 
Police looking for Morrison found her body at the landfill after suspecting that her body had been put in an alley trash container in St. Louis. They traced the trash collection route to the landfill, according to Marissa Police Chief Tom Prather. 
Prather said a cadaver dog team located the body about 10:30 a.m. Tuesday in Waste Management Inc.'s Cottonwood Hills landfill, about 30 miles southeast of downtown St. Louis. Waste Management Inc. takes trash from the St. Louis Refuse Department. 
The Illinois State Police and the St. Clair County coroner’s office also are working on the case. 
Morrison's family reported her missing Saturday.
